Package etomica.action.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.action.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

    The Controller organizes and executes all actions and activities during a running simulation.

    A Simulation run consists of one or more Activities performed sequentially. An Activity is a "long-running" task considered to be the driver of the simulation; typically integration with ActivityIntegrate. The Controller facilitates interactive simulations by optionally running Activities on a separate thread and provides an interface to pause, resume, and submit Actions which can modify the simulation in a thread-safe manner. For non-interactive simulation runs, the same Activities can be executed on the current thread with runActivityBlocking.

    See Also:
    IAction, Activity

      • addActivity

        public <A extends Activity> Controller.ActivityHandle<A> addActivity​(A activity)
        Adds an Activity to be executed by the Controller on a separate thread. Activities will be run in the order they are added, with the next one starting after the current one completes. Activities will not begin execution until the start method has been called. The returned ActivityHandle contains a `CompletableFuture` which will be completed when the activity finishes.
        Parameters:
        activity -

      • runActivityBlocking

        Runs an activity to completion on the current thread.

      • submitActionInterrupt

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> submitActionInterrupt​(IAction action)
        Submit an Action which will be executed on the Activity thread before its next step. Since the Action is guaranteed not to run concurrently with the Activity's calculations, any modification of Simulation properties will be free of data races.
        Parameters:
        action -
        Returns:
